document_data.name: Grand Gate of Delights
document_data.mainbody: The '''Grand Gate of Delights''' was the main entrance for the [[Palace of the Enlightened Throne]] in [[Huzuz]] in [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}
document_data.Description: This gate complex consisted of two gates and a pair of towers that stood 90 ft. (27 m) high. One of the gates was made from white [[marble]] and the other from fine [[alabaster]]. The first gate was decorated with gems and [[gold]] depicting a mage flying on a carpet. The second gate was inlaid with [[silver]] and white gems showing a [[djinni]] flying through the sky.
document_data.Defenses:
As shown by the images adorning the artistic gates, the Grand Gate was protected by both magic and [[genie]]s in addition to soldiers.

A [[wizard]] using a ''[[monocle of magic detection]]'' made note of any visitor radiating a magical aura. The visitor would not necessarily be stopped for carrying magical items, but they would be watched closely.

A large gong was used in dire circumstances. If struck, hundreds of additional soldiers and dozens of mages would arrives within moments.
document_data.Activities: The gates were usually left open, allowing thousands of visitors into the Palace each day.
document_data.Inhabitants: [[Sedji al-Sanje]] commanded the gate guards and [[Naib ibn-Sodar]] commanded the wizards assigned to the Grand Gate.
